io.prismic

Class Api

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.prismic.Api

  • public class Api
extends Object
    Embodies an API endpoint, from which it is possible to make queries. This object should be instantiated once per webpage on your project, at the very beginning of the webpage, and then used for every subsequent document query.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Api

        public Api(Api.ApiData apiData,
           String accessToken,
           String defaultReference,
           Cache cache,
           Logger logger)
        Constructor to build a proper Api object. This is not to build an Api object from an Api endpoint (the most usual case). In this case, you'll use the API.get method.
        Parameters:
        apiData - the data retrieved from the API document, ready to be stored in memory
        accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
        defaultReference - The default reference to use with queries. Will default to master if null
        cache - instance of a class that implements the Cache interface, and will handle the cache
        logger - instance of a class that implements the Logger interface, and will handle the logging

      • Api

        @Deprecated
public Api(Api.ApiData apiData,
                       String accessToken,
                       Cache cache,
                       Logger logger)
        Deprecated. 

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public static String getVersion()
        Returns:
        the kit version as declared in the pom.xml

      • get

        public static Api get(String endpoint,
                      String accessToken,
                      String defaultReference,
                      Cache cache,
                      Logger logger)
        Entry point to get an Api object. Example: API api = API.get("https://lesbonneschoses.prismic.io/api", null, new Cache.BuiltInCache(999), new Logger.PrintlnLogger());
        Parameters:
        endpoint - the endpoint of your prismic.io content repository, typically https://yourrepoid.prismic.io/api
        accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
        defaultReference - The default reference to use with queries. Will default to master if null
        cache - instance of a class that implements the Cache interface, and will handle the cache
        logger - instance of a class that implements the Logger interface, and will handle the logging
        Returns:
        the usable API object

      • get

        public static Api get(String endpoint,
                      String accessToken,
                      Cache cache,
                      Logger logger)

      • get

        public static Api get(String url,
                      Cache cache,
                      Logger logger)

      • get

        public static Api get(String url,
                      String accessToken,
                      String defaultReference)
        Entry point to get an Api object. Example: API api = API.get("https://lesbonneschoses.prismic.io/api", null);
        Parameters:
        url - the endpoint of your prismic.io content repository, typically https://yourrepoid.prismic.io/api
        accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)
        Returns:
        the usable API object

        Parameters:

        accessToken - Your Oauth access token if you wish to use one (to access future content releases, for instance)

      • getLogger

        public Logger getLogger()

      • getAccessToken

        public String getAccessToken()

      • getCache

        public Cache getCache()

      • getRefs

        public List<Ref> getRefs()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the ref IDs (points in a prismic.io repository's timeline, whether in the past, in the present, or in the future) to which the passed credentials give access.
        Returns:
        the list of ref IDs

      • getRef

        public Ref getRef(String label)
        From a properly built Api object, returns the ref with the corresponding label
        Parameters:
        label - the ref label as defined in the Writing Room
        Returns:
        the Ref, or null if not found

      • getBookmarks

        public Map<String,String> getBookmarks()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the map associating the bookmark names to their document IDs. Therefore, to get a bookmarked document's ID, it will look like this: api.getBookmarks().get("home")
        Returns:
        the map <name, id>

      • getTypes

        public Map<String,String> getTypes()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the map associating the type names to their readable text. Therefore, to get a type's readable text, it will look like this: api.getTypes().get("blog")
        Returns:
        the map <name, text>

      • getTags

        public List<String> getTags()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the list of available tags. Therefore, to get all available tags, it will look like this: api.getTags()
        Returns:
        the list of tags

      • getFormNames

        public Map<String,String> getFormNames()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the Map of available form names.
        Returns:
        the map <name, proper_name>

      • getForm

        public Form.SearchForm getForm(String form)
        From a properly built Api object, return a Form object that will allow to perform queries. Currently, all the forms offered by prismic.io are SearchForms, but this will change. To use it: api.get("everything").query(.....)......
        Parameters:
        form - the name of the form to query on
        Returns:
        the form to use to perform the query
        See Also:
        Form.SearchForm

      • getExperiments

        public Experiments getExperiments()
        Return the current experiments on the repository
        Returns:
        the Experiments object

      • getMaster

        public Ref getMaster()
        From a properly built Api object, returns the ref ID (points in a prismic.io repository's timeline, whether in the past, in the present, or in the future) of the master ref (the one presently live).
        Returns:
        the ref object representing the master ref

        public Form.SearchForm query()

      • previewSession

        public String previewSession(String token,
                             LinkResolver linkResolver,
                             String defaultUrl)
        Return the URL to display a given preview
        Parameters:
        token - as received from Prismic server to identify the content to preview
        linkResolver - the link resolver to build URL for your site
        defaultUrl - the URL to default to return if the preview doesn't correspond to a document (usually the home page of your site)
        Returns:
        the URL you should redirect the user to preview the requested change
